abstract: Experts had long warned that deadly earthquake in Katmandu was inevitable given tectonics, local geology, lax construction of buildings and high concentration of people; geologists say region, at center of tectonic clash between India and Asia that created Himalayas, is subject to major earthquakes roughly every 75 years.
lead_paragraph: More than 25 million years ago, India crashed into Asia. The two land masses are still colliding today, creating the world’s highest mountains and setting off major earthquakes about every 75 years.

headline.main: Ancient Collision Made Nepal Earthquake Inevitable
headline.print_headline: Ancient Slam Made Quake Inevitable Epochs Later

snippet: More than 25 million years ago, India crashed into Asia. The two land masses are still colliding today, creating the world’s highest mountains and setting off major earthquakes about every 75 years.
